citation.article-title: Emended description of the genus Polynucleobacter and the species Polynucleobacter necessarius and proposal of two subspecies, P. necessarius subsp. necessarius subsp. nov. and P. necessarius subsp. asymbioticus subsp. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of Polynucleobacter necessarius Heckmann and Schmidt 1987
Polynucleobacter necessarius (nec.es.sa′ri.us. L. masc. adj. necessarius indispensable, necessary).
Contains obligate endosymbionts living in ciliates of the species E. aediculatus and E. harpa, as well as obligately free-living strains inhabiting freshwater systems.
The DNA G+C content is 44–46 mol%, and genome sizes range from 1.5 to 2.5 Mbp.
Members can be distinguished from other taxa by the presence of the oligonucleotide sequence 5′-GAGCCGGTGTTTCTTCCC-3′ (Escherichia coli position 445–463) within the 16S rRNA gene sequence.
The presence of this sequence can be determined by fluorescent in situ hybridization of whole cells by using the fluorescently labelled oligonucleotide probe PnecC-16S-445 (Hahn et al., 2005).
